action.action-desc: Mr. Lawler introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to increase the payments or allowances that individuals, including veterans service organizations, receive for transportation of veterans to or from facilities of the Department of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Heroes Earned Affordable Lifts Act or the HEAL Act.

section.header: Expansion of payments or allowances for transportation of veterans to or from Department facilities

subsection.text: Section 111 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking at a rate of 41.5 cents per mile and inserting at the rate prescribed under subsection (g);
in subsection (b)(1), by striking Except as provided in subsection (c) of this section and notwithstanding subsection (g)(2) of this section or and inserting Notwithstanding; and
by amending subsection (g) to read as follows:

subsection.text: The Secretary shall set the mileage rate under subsection (a) to be equal to the rate for a privately owned automobile when no Government vehicle is available, as prescribed by the Administrator of General Services under section 5707(b) of title 5.
Section 111(c) of such title is amended to read as follows:
The Secretary may not require a deductible for travel for examination, treatment, or care under this section.

paragraph.text: Section 111(e)(2)(B) of such title is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking subparagraph is and all that follows and inserting subparagraph is—; and
by adding at the end the following new clauses:

clause.text: a provider of personal care services for such veteran who is approved under paragraph (6) of section 1720G(a) of this title or designated under paragraph (7) of such section 1720G(a);
a veterans service organization that provides transportation for such veteran under section 111A of this title; or
a veterans service agency of a local government, including an employee or a volunteer of such agency, that provides transportation for such veteran.

paragraph.text: Section 111A(b) of such title is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking veterans’ service and inserting veterans service; and
by striking , without reimbursement from the Department, and inserting (reimbursable by the Department only to the extent allowable under section 111 of this title).
